item.title: Zuci - A Phy-gital multiplayer turn based strategy game
item.description: Overview BACKGROUND Folk musical instruments bind oneâ€™s community together. Each instrument has a certain role, location, and time to be performed within a community. The audience for traditional folk musical instruments has, however, shrunk significantly as modern electronic musical instruments and music have become more widely accepted. OBJECTIVE The main goal of this project was to teach participants about folk musical instruments through their sounds, method of construction, relationship with different communities and their festivals

item.title: Zuci - A Phy-gital multiplayer turn based strategy game
item.description: INTRODUCTION Folk musical instruments bind one’s community together. Within a community, each instrument has its own specific use, place and time to be played. However, with the popularization of new electronic musical instruments and music, the audience base of traditional folk musical instruments have decreased considerably . To gather more information about the same, we met with Brahmaputra cultural Foundation(BCF), an NGO who is working on conserving folk musical instruments of the North-eastern states of India.

item.title: Sharing knowledge about Folk musical instruments
item.description: Overview BACKGROUND Traditional folk musical instruments are facing extinction in many parts of India due to decrease in its user base. The purpose of this study was to determine an effective medium to introduce these musical instruments: their construction process, sounds and events they are used at, to a younger audience, in order to create a future user base of individuals with better understanding of the same. OBJECTIVE Through this study we aim to introduce different mediums of instruction to children above age of 8 years and observe how they respond to them.

item.title: Sharing knowledge about Folk musical instruments
item.description: OVERVIEW Background Traditional folk musical instruments are facing extinction in many parts of India due to decrease in its user base. The purpose of this study was to determine an effective medium to introduce these musicalinstruments : their construction process, sounds and events they are used at, to a younger audience , in order to create a future user base of individuals with better understanding of the same. Objective Through this study we aim to introduce different mediums of instruction to children above age of 8 years and observe how they respond to them.
